summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear before the grand jury on August 20, 2019, and to produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena includes an attached rider detailing the recipient's rights and the scope of the requested materials.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to gather evidence for a grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The unnamed recipient is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury for the Southern District of New York to testify and give evidence.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 15, 2019, for an appearance on August 20, 2019, indicating active federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein at that time.
The subpoena demands production of 'All materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein,' including text messages, emails, social media messages, documents, and notes.
The subpoena has a broad scope, covering materials on computers, email accounts, iCloud accounts, servers, cellphones, and other devices, whether in the U.S. or abroad.
The subpoena references alleged violations of federal statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction, alteration, or falsification of records).
The recipient of the subpoena is not named in the provided text, indicating it is a redacted or partially shown document.
